ai-iti96:1.1_0: For this was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
ai-iti96:2.1_0: “Mendicants, one attached to both sensual pleasures and rebirth is a returner, who comes back to this state of existence.
ai-iti96:2.2_0: One detached from sensual pleasures but still attached to rebirth is a non-returner, who comes not back to this state of existence.
ai-iti96:2.3_0: One detached from both sensual pleasures and rebirth is a perfected one, who has ended defilements.”
ai-iti96:3.2_0: and the danger of continued existence,
ai-iti96:3.4_0: and fare on in birth and death.
ai-iti96:4.1_0: Those who’ve given up sensual pleasures
ai-iti96:4.2_0: without attaining the end of defilements,
ai-iti96:4.3_0: and are still attached to being reborn,
ai-iti96:5.1_0: Those who have cut off doubt,
ai-iti96:5.2_0: and ended conceit and future lives,
ai-iti96:5.3_0: They are those in the world who’ve crossed over,
ai-iti96:5.4_0: Those who have ended the defilements.
ai-iti96:6.1_0: That is what the Buddha has heard.
ai-iti96:6.3_0: Third: there is an invitation to admonish.
